2:
"Even today my complaint is bitter;\q my hand \f + \ft Some copies have: \fqa ... his hand ... \fqa* \f* is heavy because of my groaning.


\q
3:
Oh, that I knew where I might find him!\q Oh, that I might come to his place!
\q
4:
I would lay my case in order before him\q and fill my mouth with arguments.
\q
5:
I would learn the words with which he would answer me\q and would understand what he would say to me.


\q
6:
Would he argue against me in the greatness of his power?\q No, he would pay attention to me.
\q
7:
There the upright person might argue with him.\q In this way I would be acquitted forever by my judge.


\q
8:
See, I go eastward, but he is not there,\q and westward, but I cannot perceive him.
\q
9:
To the north, where he is at work, but I cannot see him,\q and to the south, where he hides himself so that I cannot see him.


\q
10:
But he knows the way that I take;\q when he has tested me, I will come out like gold.
\q
11:
My foot has held fast to his steps;\q I have kept to his way and turned not aside.
\q
12:
I have not gone back from the commandment of his lips;\q I have treasured the words of his mouth more than my portion of food.


\q
13:
But he is one of a kind, who can turn him back?\q What he desires, he does.
\q
14:
For he carries out his decree against me;\q there are many like them.


\q
15:
Therefore, I am terrified in his presence;\q when I think about him, I am afraid of him.
\q
16:
For God has made my heart weak;\q the Almighty has terrified me.
\q
17: I have not been brought to an end by darkness,\q because of the thick darkness that covers the gloom of my face.
